Reviews.Title: Spectacular photo quality
Reviews.Author: Nunya Biz

} cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81GUjhEaiYS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXpreplay.parentNode; var cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXcurrentClick) { return cv_moHOYJ66S3RWRXcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:35 MinsOne word: WOW. I'm just so thrilled with this camera. It's so easy to use, I didn't once have to break out the instructions to get this thing up and going. It's super sleek looking and the color is a nice touch. Most importantly - the quality of photos is just amazing. Even under low light conditions, the quality doesn't suffer. You can shoot photos pretty quickly and there isnt a long pause time, for those wanting to take quick shots and not miss the moment. Battery life is excellent; I've easily taken 150+ pictures and several videos and the batteries are still going strong. Videos are okay, definitely not HD quality, but I didn't purchase this camera for that feature, and it's nice having video capability if nothing else is available.Anyway, my video should speak for itself. There are several different modes to choose from for those who are control freaks. As far as the "share" feature, I'm not quite sold on it yet. It's easier for me to just put the SD card into my computer rather than go through the hassle of going through each photo, selecting it, choosing the share option, plugging it into the computer...etc., etc. Overall, a great camera for such a low price and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Great Price
Reviews.Author: Booklover
Reviews.Content: I Love It. When I push the GO button there is No Hesitation. The photos of my grandkids, birds and my pets are great. The movies are good quality. You can turn off the red-eye preflash - that helps with the animal photos. It is small and light weight. It takes standard AA batteries. Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures and super easy to use!
Reviews.Author: M. Viola
Reviews.Content: Just as the title says this camera takes Nice pictures and is super easy to use!Also, the red is an excellent color!

Reviews.Title: Fast shutter lag.
Reviews.Author: zmkr788
Reviews.Content: this camera has the fastest shutter lag and shot to shot speed I have seen in a long time, we had a real slow camera before and it would take for ever between pressing the button and actually sparking the flash and taking the picture, maybe like 3 or 4 seconds, this Kodak takes the picture fast so you can move on with your day, great price, fast delivery I got one for me and one for my wife, she loves it and our daughter now wants our cameras, I know what to get for her birth day.

Reviews.Title: Ordered Red, got Silver
Reviews.Author: Veronica Godoy "Veronica"
Reviews.Content: I think the Camera is easy to use, but you must stock up on the double AA batteries, I like using batteries though and thats why I picked it. Got me on the share quality and although I just received today, the pictures do look good. Will post more info when I use it more, photoshare and print up copies. Happy Shopping.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Gidget
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a easy point and click camera for my seven year old daughter. It is a great camera for what we needed. Easy to use and the pictures are great. Sure beats the kid cameras that you can buy. It is also very reasonable in price! Would reccommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot for your money!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Sutton
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer, and my main camera is a Canon 5D Mark II 21 MP DSLR camera.  With that in mind, I also always have a point-and-shoot camera on hand for day trips where I don't feel like lugging around my huge camera.  I had a Kodak easy share in 2007, then bought a fujifilm and a canon.  The fujifilm and canon never had the same quality that I got from the kodaks, so I stumbled upon this camera and decided to try it out as a gift for my 4 year old son's 5th birthday.Right out of the box, I put in the batteries and took a few test shots.  Amazing, beautiful pictures, just on the screen.  I liked them so much that I bought another for my Mother for her anniversary.  She just took the camera to Baltimore for their anniversary date.  Keep in mind, I had taken my DSLR to Baltimore just a few weeks ago.  The photos were beautiful!  The colors are vibrant, the quality is GREAT, and I am VERY happy with this camera.One thing to keep in mind: make sure you hold the shutter button down half way and wait for the little "beep" for it to focus.  It will focus perfect every time.  The flash isn't too washed out, and as long as you use rechargeable batteries you'll be just fine.  What a GREAT value for the money!

Reviews.Title: Good but disappointed
Reviews.Author: S.Graber
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my 8 year old, who loves red. The description said camera was "red"; box said camera was "red"  But camera was actually silver.  I offered to return it, but my daughter wanted to keep the silver one.  I personally was disappointed given the false indicators that it was a red camera.  As for quality, the camera is pretty basic and is a good "first" camera for a child. The picture quality is left wanting, though.  You must buy a separate SD card, but that is pretty common.  If you are buying for yourself and can afford it, I recommend Canon cameras.  I have always had good luck and great pictures with that brand of cameras.  But, I would recommend this as a gift for a child.

Reviews.Title: Battery door flimsy
Reviews.Author: TribalMama
Reviews.Content: The camera works great & perfect for my 9 year old daughter but the battery door broke after a few days. We were able to have it replaced but the second battery door broke, as well. I'm in the process of trying to get the second camera replaced which is very inconvenient.  Hopefully Kodak has fixed the problem!

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price
Reviews.Author: JustMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: If you are on the budget and needs a simple aim and shoot device, this is a product you may want to consider.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C143 (Red)
Reviews.Author: Timothy N. Kline
Reviews.Content: Great small compact camera that takes great pictures! Camera is easy to operate and hold. Had a previous Kodak M340 and got this one for my wife, who likes a camera that's simple and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: MAYA KARLAS
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with battery that kind of froze camera completely. I used Kodak battery that came with the package and it was empty 2nd day. I e-mailed the seller and got a very quick response letting me know to use Lithium batteris. Since then i did not have any other issues with it. I am still on 1st 2 lithium batteries, taking a lots of great pictures. Highly recommended by me.

Reviews.Title: Uncertain about this purchase
Reviews.Author: Wendy "Ballroom Dancer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an inexpensive, easy to use camera that I could just throw in a pack. On the positive side, it's very easy to use. On the negative side, it makes noise while turned on and I'm concerned about it breaking quickly. I usually use Nikons but wanted a less expensive camera. If it holds up, I'll be pleased with it but the constant noise is worrying me.

Reviews.Title: A good first camera.
Reviews.Author: NiHun415
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Y', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2YloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2YpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay) { cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91TCGDiRe9S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91TCGDiRe9S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2Ypreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2YcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2YcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2YQ1YW6BWYV2YcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:10 MinsGiven the price of this camera, if it's all you can afford it's a good buy. However, I wouldn't say the photos are stunning. They're decent, better than some, but a far cry from cameras even just twice the price. The Easyshare function is quite nice, but I will be traveling over the summer and probably buying a better camera for my trip. If you're buying your teenager a first camera - this is a good one, as it looks pretty cool, and is easy to use with any computer, without having to buy other devices to upload your photos, etc. But it does freeze occasionally, turn off suddenly, and uses up batteries way too quickly. (Also, photos often come out a bit blurry - unless you have arms of steel or a tripod/something sturdy to put the camera on.)

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: cindy
Reviews.Content: I WAS IMPRESSED BY HOW SMALL YET EASY TO USE THIS CAMERA WAS,WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANYONE THAT NEEDS A SIMPLE TO USE CAMERA THAT WORKS GREAT

Reviews.Title: Great Quality! Great Price! ... One complaint
Reviews.Author: Gretchen
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I purchased for my young photographer daughter and she loves it.  Fits well in her hands, solid build quality, VERY easy to operate, and takes standard AA batteries... great in case they die while away from a charger (just buy standard rechargeable AA's for under $10).  (Her)Only complaint is that when recording video clips, sound will not playback on the camera.  It will playback once you download to a computer, but if you want to show a clip to someone on the camera, you're out of luck.  Clearly some product designer at Kodak really "goofed" and someone probably got fired, but the result is a really inexpensive camera for the rest of us.  Thanks "Careless Kodak Guy" :)

Reviews.Title: A Great Basic Camera
Reviews.Author: sms
Reviews.Content: For a while I've been busily researching cameras for my 5 year old daughter.  She's a pretty responsible kid (as 5 year olds go), but I didn't want to spend a fortune on her first camera.  I also didn't want to buy her a "kids camera".  The ones I found were really nothing more than toys.  I landed on this camera as a good balance between price and features, and I'm very pleased with the purchase.  The camera was easy to setup, has a big, bright LCD screen, and takes a great picture.  Most importantly, it's easy enough for a 5 year old to pick it up pretty quickly.  It does a lot more than she'll need at this point, but it's a camera she'll be able to grow into.

Reviews.Title: Sams 8th Birthday Present
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: Sam loves his camera. He has it with him all the time. Scouting trip ,he has taken some great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: PLOTTAPUS
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these camera's for my grand children that were going to Washington DC for a spring break vacation with my son & his wife. I would say the canera's were "OK" for a 11 year old & a 7 year old. I would NEVER buy this camera for myself. My grand kids loved them but again these cameras are not the best & I would defenitly NOT buy them for a gift for an adult.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: Zazzy
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Kodak EasyShare from a few years back and I loved it - until my dad dropped it and it broke. I bought this as a replacement, and it's basically the same thing.The differences are slightly annoying, though -1. It makes skin look blotchy in close range, like it detects every reflection and blemish within the skin.2. It makes a faint buzzing noise when turned on.It was still a faithful and invaluable companion when I went to a convention two weeks ago and I'm glad I had it. It's nice, but those two points are slightly frustrating.

Reviews.Title: no play back sound
Reviews.Author: jade
Reviews.Content: the cammera takes excellent picture and all but the video quality is little grainy and when i play back a video on my computer i dont hear any sound allthough the camera has a micro phone. i dont know if i have to change some setings or what . please leave a comment if you have a solution for my problem

Reviews.Title: cheap
Reviews.Author: kathleenturza
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this camera, it's cheap and, althought the quality of pics are pretty good....the sound did not work and it's really quite large compared to whats out there.

ProductInfo.Features:
12 megapixels for high-quality pictures
3X optical zoom
2.7 in. bright LCD
One-button upload to e-mail, Kodak Gallery, YouTube, Facebook, ORKUT, and FLICKR sites
Kodak’s Smart Capture feature
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare C143 Digital Camera (Red)
